Question: Millions of people living all over the world have cancer. Is cancer a pandemic?

Choices:
A: No, because cancer is not contagious.
B: No, because cancer is not always fatal.
C: Yes, because millions of people have cancer.
D: Yes, because people all over the world have cancer.
steps: The term "pandemic" typically refers to an infectious disease that spreads across a large geographic area and affects many people. It implies contagion and transmission from person to person.
Cancer is not an infectious disease; it is caused by genetic, environmental, and lifestyle factors and does not spread from one person to another.
While millions of people do have cancer and it affects many regions globally, this alone does not meet the criteria for a pandemic since it is not a contagious disease.
